titleStmt.title: Two-Dimensional Object Localization by Coarse-to-Fine Correlation Matching

analytic.title: Two-Dimensional Object Localization by Coarse-to-Fine Correlation Matching

abstract.p: We present a Mean Field Theory method for locating two-dimensional objects that have undergone rigid transformations. The resulting algorithm is a form of coarse-to-fine correlation matching. We first consider problems of matching synthetic point data, and derive a point matching objective function. A tractable line segment matching objective function is derived by considering each line segment as a dense collection of points, and approximating it by a sum of Gaussians. The algorithm is tested on real images from which line segments are extracted and matched.
